title: Seitan Lamb Chops

author.name: Brian L. Patton
author.note: Author of Sexy’s Best: The Vegan Fried Chicken of Your Dreams.

description: Whether it's a holiday gathering or an intimate dinner party, our Seitan Lamb Chops will be the star of the show. Delight your guests and savor unforgettable moments with this exquisite vegan creation.

instructions: In a small pot over medium heat, add oil and onions.
Cook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until translucent and slightly browned around edges.
Add garlic, rosemary, lentils, and 2½ cups water.
Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce to a simmer for 10 to 12 minutes until lentils are tender.
Set aside to cool, and remove rosemary sprig.
Into a food processor, add lentil mixture and rice vinegar, and process until smooth.
In a large mixing bowl, add vital wheat gluten, paprika, salt, and asafetida, and stir to combine.
Add lentil mixture, and knead together with hands.
Once all dry ingredients are absorbed, knead dough for 1 minute, then let rest for 10 minutes.
Form dough into a large ball, and cut in half.
With cut sides facing up, flatten tops, and form into two 5-inch-long oblong roasts.
Tightly wrap each roast in two layers of foil to fully enclose, shaping around roast to maintain its oblong shape.
In a large pot with a steamer basket over high heat, add remaining 4 cups water.
Bring water to boil, then add roasts to basket and steam for 45 minutes.
Remove from basket and let cool to room temperature in foil.
In a small bowl, whisk 2 teaspoons soy sauce, mustard, and maple syrup.
Remove foil and brush both roasts generously with soy sauce mixture until completely coated.
Sprinkle all sides with pepper, thyme, salt, and sugar.
In a wide skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter.
Once it sizzles, add roasts.
Sear 2 to 3 minutes on each side until browned.
Then hold each roast vertically with a pair of tongs, to brown bottoms.
Remove from pan, place on a plate, and tent with aluminum foil to keep warm.
On a wide plate, add jicama and remaining 1 teaspoon soy sauce, and toss together.
In 1 roast, insert 6 jicama sticks 1 inch evenly along one side of roast.
Repeat with second roast.
For the zesty mint drizzle, in small bowl, add all ingredients and stir to combine.
Garnish a platter with lemon slices and pomegranate seeds.
Serve warm roasts whole to be carved at the table, or slice between each jicama stick to make chops.
Spoon zesty mint drizzle on top, or serve on the side.

sidebars.label: Make Ahead
content: Cut down on holiday dinner stress by making your roasts ahead of time. Follow directions for our Seitan Lamb Chops, and once roasts are steamed and cooled to room temperature, tightly wrap in plastic wrap and store in refrigerator up to 2 days before serving. The day of your feast, let refrigerated roasts come to room temperature, then continue with searing, adding jicama sticks, garnishing, and serving with zesty mint drizzle.

sidebars.label: Spice Trade
content: Asafetida, also known as hing, is a potent spice often used in Indian cooking. It imparts an umami flavor and can be found in Indian markets or online. Replace with onion powder if unavailable.
